item.description:
Join us this and every Monday this summer from 6:30-9:30 pm for Salsa in the Park!

These fun outdoor events are sponsored by the Mayor's Office and are FREE and open to everyone--bring the whole family if you'd like! Whether you've been dancing salsa for years or you'd like to learn how, or if you'd just like to relax after work to the sounds of salsa music, join us in the park on Monday nights!


We've had such a great response that we have added a 2nd dance floor--last week over 150 people participated! Our new floor is a sprung wood surface and was donated by the Boston Dance Alliance.

Each night will feature live performances, dance instruction for all levels (beginner to advanced), and lots of time to dance and socialize. There will be food and drinks for sale, as well as other items. We have a great dance floor, and lots of friendly dancers (of all levels) to connect with!

Special this week:
*Salsa Y Control Dance Company will be performing at 7:00 pm!
*15-minute beginner lessons will be offered at 6:30, 7:30 & 8:30 pm!
*15-minute lessons for advanced beginners & intermediates at 6:30 & 7:30 pm!

Please note: If it rains, the party will be inside the Community Center

Sponsors & Collaborators include: SalsaBoston.com, DJ Hernan, El Show de Fernandito, Teddy Shoes, Sociedad Latina, MetaMovements and Boston ROCKS!

Dates & Times: Mondays, June 30-August 18; 6:30 PM - 9:30 PM

Location: At Blackstone Community Center Park; 50 W. Brookline St, in the South End. It's near the corner of W. Brookline & Washington Streets. Look for the community center and the basketball courts, and we will be right next to them! (The fountain is visible from where we are, directly across W Brookline St from us.)

For more information: www.metamovements.com
Telephone: 617 983-1418
Its great if you can RSVP through the meet-up group, but its not required!

Additional Info: On-Street parking is available and Public Transportation is easily accessible:

a) Orange line to Back Bay, exit Dartmouth Street side (Its about a 10 minute walk). Take a left on Dartmouth and continue, till you cross over Tremont Street and it becomes W.Dedham Street...then go left on Shawmut Ave, and right onto W Brookline St.; walk down and the basketball courts, center & park are on your left.

b) Silver Line (Washington St line): Get off at the Newton St. stop. You will be on Washington St. If you were coming from Dudley and towards Boylston, you will continue in the direction the bus is going for one more block, and take a left at W. Brookline; walk down and the basketball courts, center & park are on your right. If you were coming from Boylston and towards Dudley, you will walk back one block, and take a left on W. Brookline as described above.

c) #1 bus down Mass Ave. (from Harvard or Central Squares). Get off at Washington St, and take a left (heading towards downtown, away from Roxbury). Continue to W. Brookline St, and take a left;walk down and the basketball courts, center & park are on your right.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll have my hair in a bun, and will be wearing a black "MM Salsa" tank top

group.name: The Boston & Cambridge Salsa Meetup Group

item.name: Salsa in the Park--now with a 2nd dance floor and over 150 participants!
